alpha.meaning: Significance level for conditional independence tests
alpha.reasoning: Use 0.1 for small samples (<500) to maintain sensitivity. Use 0.05 for moderate samples (500-10000). Use 0.01 for large samples (>10000). Use 0.001 for very large samples (>100000) to minimize false positives.

is_discrete.meaning: Whether the data contains discrete variables
is_discrete.reasoning: Set to true when working with discrete or mixed data types to use appropriate independence tests. Set to false for purely continuous data to use optimized continuous tests.
